reviews.review: this was my second ever purchase on steam and man i could play this forever, probably one of if not, my favourite game of all time. not much really needs to be said here, none of the puzzles feel overwhelming or painfully difficult, but still definitely a challenge. all of the characters are built up really well, the game feels and looks amazing. really wish portal 3 would be a thing, but sadly i don't think we'll ever get it
Very good game to kill time, easy to play with a good story line.

Could I just say this is the perfect first person puzzle game? . . . Of course I can, I pay the bills here I can talk about the game all dang day.
Portal 2 is challenging, mysterious, captivating, and most of all... FUNNY. I love the dialog in this game, from the cheeky remarks from some characters to the simple but welcome insults generated by our favorite neurotoxin huffing, genocidal, testing addicted, scientific discovery driven, cake loving AI, GLaDOS.

Simply put... Buy it... Buy it Now
IT HAS BEEN 8 YEARS SINCE PORTAL 2 RELEASED... JUST BUY THE GAME ALREADY
This game is everything that I want in a Valve game, fun gameplay, great level design, and an amazing story. This game is the perfect puzzle game for me, if you have the time. Play. This. Game.

Ich bin von dem Spiel sehr begeistert. Das Spiel ist deutlich l√§nger und umfangreicher als der erste Teil. Die Story hat mir genauso gut gefallen. Die R√§tsel sind knifflig aber nicht unfair. Ein Mehrspieler mit eigener Story ist auch dabei. Diese war zwar nicht so umfangreich wie die des Einzelspielers, macht aber trotzdem Spa√ü. Durch einen Leveleditor, mit dem man eigene Level erstellen und hochladen kann, kann man sich im Prinzip unbegrenzt mit dem Spiel besch√§ftigen. Wenn einem der erste Teil gefallen hat, ist es auf jeden Fall empfehlenswert.

one of my favorite games of all time.

Edit 2/14/2021: It's been almost 2 years since I made this review and I now have over 100 hours in this game. The workshop maps, while not all winners, have just kept me coming back over and over again. This is absolutely one of, if not my favorite games ever made, with infinite replay value, a vibrant mapping and modding scene even 10 years later, and a landmark title in gaming. Please play this game, I'm begging you.

---

Some people say this game is a masterpiece and/or a classic. Probably because it's a masterpiece and a classic. It's one of the only games I've ever replayed. The puzzles are fun and challenging, and the characters are so memorable. If you haven't bought this game, buy it. The bundle that includes both Portal games is only $15 on a normal day, that's some real bang for your buck.

tl;dr just get the damn game please 10/10
In my opinion, this is the best game valve have ever produce. It have good character, good gameplay, and good story.

Does not disappoint. Huge fan of the Original Portal and this was such a great sequel. The puzzles get a little weird at the end, but it's part of the story and I like that because some of them were more challenging. I really hope we get more from this series.

Before playing this game I thought to myself how could Valve improve on a game that was nearly flawless and the answer was that they couldn't and at the same time they did it.

For me to explain this first I gotta say that Portal has problem what I think the best teaching mechanics and ideias how to play with that mechanic level design that I ever saw, something that also makes Resident Evil 4 one of my favorite games of all time, but it was more of working with an idea than a full fledged game, Portal 2 is the game that came from that idea.

Portal 2 is far more ambitious than it's predecessor and along to way to that ambition it does have missteps that the first game didn't but also shines more brightly in others places that the first game couldn't.

The puzzles while some are lackluster and the player can clearly see the developers losing some steam (forgive me for the bad joke) others showcase a mastery in creating creative solutions and making the player really fell like they are the most intelligent person on the planet while they are only being played by the level design in a way that far exceeds the first game. Another thing that far exceeds the first one is the writing, the writers feels a lot more comfortable with the characters and the overall story of the game is on a another  level compared to it's predecessor.

So in some ways it's level design is worse than Portal, I can't see how could this sequel exists and do not let down the fans of the first game which is almost perfect, it achieved the expectations that people had in it and actually surpassed it just by doing that.
